name: Backpack
description: A leather pack carried on the back, typically with straps to secure it.

name: Bedroll
description: A portable sleeping mat that can be rolled up for easy transport.

name: Blanket
description: A thick cloth covering for warmth while sleeping or resting.

name: Candle
description: For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

name: Chain (10 ft.)
description: A chain has 10 hit points. It can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength check.

name: Chalk (1 piece)
description: A stick of chalk for marking surfaces.

name: Climber's Kit
description: Includes special pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness. You can use it to anchor yourself; when you do, you can't fall more than 25 feet from the point where you anchored yourself, and you can't climb more than 25 feet away from that point without undoing the anchor.

name: Clothes, Common
description: A simple set of clothes typical of common folk.

name: Clothes, Fine
description: Elegant clothing suitable for nobility or wealthy merchants.

name: Clothes, Traveler's
description: Sturdy clothing designed for travel and outdoor activity.

name: Component Pouch
description: A small, watertight leather belt pouch that has compartments to hold all the material components and other special items you need to cast your spells, except for those components that have a specific cost.

name: Crowbar
description: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

name: Flask
description: A metal or ceramic container for holding liquids, typically about 1 pint capacity.

name: Grappling Hook
description: A metal hook attached to a rope, used for climbing or catching objects.

name: Hammer
description: A standard hammer useful for driving pitons and other tasks.

name: Healer's Kit
description: This kit is a leather pouch containing bandages, salves, and splints. The kit has ten uses. As an action, you can expend one use to stabilize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check.

name: Holy Symbol
description: A representation of a god or pantheon used as a spellcasting focus by clerics and paladins.

name: Hourglass
description: A device for measuring the passage of time.

name: Hunting Trap
description: When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center.

name: Ink (1 ounce bottle)
description: An ounce bottle of black ink.

name: Ink Pen
description: A writing implement that uses ink.

name: Ladder (10 ft.)
description: A wooden ladder 10 feet in length.

name: Lamp
description: A lamp casts bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

name: Lantern, Bullseye
description: A bullseye lantern casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

name: Lantern, Hooded
description: A hooded lantern casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

name: Lock
description: A key is provided with the lock. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick this lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check.

name: Magnifying Glass
description: This lens allows a closer look at small objects. It is also useful as a substitute for flint and steel when starting fires.

name: Manacles
description: These metal restraints can bind a Small or Medium creature. Escaping the manacles requires a successful DC 20 Dexterity check. Breaking them requires a successful DC 20 Strength check.

name: Map or Scroll Case
description: This cylindrical leather case can hold up to ten rolled-up sheets of paper or five rolled-up sheets of parchment.

name: Mess Kit
description: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

name: Mirror, Steel
description: A small steel mirror useful for looking around corners.

name: Oil (flask)
description: Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. You can splash oil on a creature within 5 feet or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering on impact.

name: Paper (one sheet)
description: A single sheet of paper for writing.

name: Parchment (one sheet)
description: A single sheet of parchment for writing.

name: Perfume (vial)
description: A small vial of fragrant perfume.

name: Pick, Miner's
description: A heavy pick used for mining.

name: Piton
description: A metal spike that can be driven into a crack or seam in rock.

name: Pole (10 ft.)
description: A 10-foot wooden pole useful for probing ahead.

name: Pot, Iron
description: An iron pot for cooking, holds 1 gallon.

name: Pouch
description: A cloth or leather pouch can hold up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things.

name: Quiver
description: A quiver can hold up to 20 arrows.

name: Rations (1 day)
description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

name: Rope, Hemp (50 ft.)
description: A 50-foot length of hemp rope. It has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

name: Rope, Silk (50 ft.)
description: A 50-foot length of silk rope. It has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

name: Sack
description: A simple cloth sack that can hold up to 1 cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear.

name: Scale, Merchant's
description: A scale includes a small balance, pans, and a suitable assortment of weights up to 2 pounds. With it, you can measure the exact weight of small objects.

name: Sealing Wax
description: Wax used for sealing letters and documents.

name: Shovel
description: A tool for digging.

name: Signal Whistle
description: A small whistle that can be heard up to 600 feet away.

name: Signet Ring
description: A ring bearing a personal seal or family crest.

name: Soap
description: A bar of soap for cleaning.

name: Spellbook
description: Essential for wizards, this leather-bound book has 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.

name: Spikes, Iron (10)
description: A set of 10 iron spikes useful for securing doors or climbing.

name: Spyglass
description: Objects viewed through a spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

name: Tent, Two-Person
description: A simple and portable canvas shelter for two people.

name: Thieves' Tools
description: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers.

name: Tinderbox
description: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire.

name: Torch
description: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

name: Vial
description: A small glass or crystal container that holds 4 ounces of liquid.

name: Waterskin
description: A leather pouch that can hold up to 4 pints of liquid.

name: Whetstone
description: A stone used for sharpening blades.
